V.iii.1.B.4.h
.
Conservative Therapy for Shin Splints
Utilize
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5262
for evaluating impairment of the tibia and fibula including nonunion, malunion (evaluated under the corresponding knee or ankle codes based on associated impairment), or medial tibial stress syndrome (MTSS).
Evaluations for MTSS may be based on the use of conservative treatment.  For this purpose, conservative treatment includes but is not limited to treatment of symptoms using the following:
rest
ice
elevation
medication
compression socks, and/or
massage.
Note
:  MTSS is synonymous with shin splints.  Related assessments, such as compartment syndrome and/or stress fractures, may also appear in treatment records.  When compartment syndrome is the predominant diagnosis, however, a rating under
38 CFR 4.73, DC 5331
is warranted.
